executive_summary: The Computer Rental industry consists of companies that rent or lease desktop and laptop computers to consumers and businesses on a short-term, long-term or rent-to-own basis. Over the five years to 2022, industry revenue has declined considerably, somewhat expedited by the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Although the necessity of computers has grown for consumers and businesses, the price of computers and peripheral equipment has steadily declined, making it less expensive for industry customers to purchase rather than rent computers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Consequently, IBISWorld estimates that industry revenue will decline at an annualized rate of 3.6% to $1.5 billion over the five years to 2022, including a decline of 2.0% in 2022 alone.

Although renting and leasing offers the advantage of acquiring equipment with minimum initial expenditures, demand for the Computer Rental industry has been undercut by the falling price of computers and peripheral equipment.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: NEW TECHNOLOGY CANNIBALIZES DEMAND FOR TRADITIONAL COMPUTER RENTAL
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The current period has also experienced increased sales of smartphones and tablets, which are increasingly siphoning demand away from traditional computers, including industry operators.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The industry will likely be undermined by the price of computers and peripheral equipment continuing to fall moving forward. Specifically, downstream customers are expected to benefit from a continued decrease in computer prices.

Over the five years to 2027, the industry's key economic drivers are expected to improve as economic recovery solidifies following the pandemic, preserving industry demand. Yet, demand for computer rental will be undermined by anticipated interest rate increases.

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that rent or lease desktop and laptop computers to consumers and businesses. Services can include short-term rentals, long-term rentals or rent-to-own programs. Lease-to-own programs are excluded from this industry.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level low - increasing

opportunities: Private investment in computers and software

key_trends: The industry has benefited from increased household income levels
Growing private investment in computers and software by businesses will likely benefit the industry
Companies have attempted to protect their balance sheets by implementing cost-cutting measures
The industry will continue to be affected by the falling price of computers and peripheral equipment

market_segmentation.segment_description: In the Computer Rental industry, businesses comprise an estimated 55.6% of revenue in 2022. Businesses that update their computers on a frequent basis and require the latest technological equipment may find leasing as more cost effective. According to a survey conducted by the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association, the ability to have the latest equipment was leasing's top perceived benefit. Moreover, these companies also rent computers for tax purposes because computers that are leased or rented can be listed as an expense rather than a depreciable asset. Some businesses also rent computers for conferences, trade shows and other events to avoid the risk and hassle of transporting in-house equipment. This market is anticipated to decline as a share of revenue in 2022 as effects from the outbreak of the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic, such as temporary closure of nonessential businesses and decline in corporate profit, linger.

The consumer market for computer rentals is dominated by low-income consumers that do not have the resources or credit to purchase a computer. Accounting for 25.4% of revenue in 2022, many of these low-income consumers aim to purchase their computer through a rent-to-own agreement. The total price premium associated with such an agreement is typically higher than the interest that would be accrued through most credit cards, reflecting the low level of financial acumen among the industry's consumers. According to the Federal Trade Commission Bureau of Economics, 73.0% of rent-to-own customers had a high school education or less (latest data available).

Consumers earning more than $25,000 account for 17.7% of industry revenue in 2022. These consumers typically have poor or unestablished credit, and therefore, cannot finance a computer purchase through other means. A survey conducted by the Federal Trade Commission Bureau of Economics found that only 44.0% of rent-to-own customer households had a credit card and less than half had a savings account (latest data available).

Government accounts for 1.3% of industry revenue in 2022. While the benefit of leasing for government organizations closely mirrors businesses, demand is dependent on local, state and federal funding. As a result, this segment has grown as a share of revenue over most of the five years to 2022. However, anticipated budget cuts in 2022 due to the coronavirus pandemic are anticipated to decrease this segment's share of revenue moving forward.

products_and_services.product_description: Desktop computers comprise 28.4% of industry revenue in 2022. This segment has decreased as a share of industry revenue over the past five years, due to the growing popularity of laptops. Historically, businesses have predominantly leased desktop computers. Telecommuting and flexible work arrangements, however, have grown in popularity and decreased demand for desktop computers. Moreover, many laptops now boast the same capabilities as desktop computers.

In the Computer Rental industry, laptops account for an estimated 64.5% of revenue in 2022, increasing as a share of industry revenue over the five years to 2022 at the expense of desktop computers. This is primarily due to the mobility benefits and lower price tag associated with laptops. Business have followed suit to provide their employees with flexible, mobile work arrangements.

The other segment includes supplementary items such as additional monitors, mice and keyboards, accounting for 7.0% of revenue in 2022. Many businesses now permit employees to telecommute with laptops and subsequently attach their laptops to monitors and keyboards at the office to avoid neck strain and comply with regulations set in place by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration, particularly during the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. As a result, this segment has increased as a share of industry revenue during the period.

tier_2_suppliers: Semiconductor & Circuit Manufacturing in the US
Circuit Board & Electronic Component Manufacturing in the US
tier_1_buyers: Finance and Insurance in the US
Professional, Scientific and Technical Services in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Consumer demand for Computer Rental industry services is dependent on disposable income, consumer confidence and access to credit. Although strong declines in disposable income discourage customers from renting at all, negative economic conditions can translate to increased industry revenue. Since consumers of industry services typically do not have easy access to credit and have difficulty purchasing computers, increased disposable income better enables customers to purchase, rather than rent equipment, negatively affecting demand.

Demand from businesses is highly dependent on private investment in computers and software. The falling price of computers and peripheral equipment has undermined demand for their rental, resulting in the industry's decline over the previous decade. As the price of computers and peripheral equipment has fallen, consumers and businesses have been better able to afford their purchase outright.

Changes in business sentiment and economic activity impact demand for this industry. Some clients tend to avoid replacing their equipment during low economic growth periods due to increasing financial pressures on profit and cash flow. Movements in interest rates influence the price of contracts and repayments which is also an important factor influencing demand for this industry. However, this industry enables for the alternate use of capital funds and shifts the costs of acquiring and holding assets from a fixed to a variable item on a company's balance sheet.

Demand from the government is highly dependent on city, state and federal funding. Local and state government investment has risen over most of the five years to 2022. However, the coronavirus pandemic and subsequent simultaneous rise in costs related to containing the pandemic and decrease in tax revenue for governments is anticipated to result in decreased demand from the government as both local and federal governments experience budget shortfalls.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Computer Rental industry is subject to several regulations regarding privacy and rental terms.
Rent-to-own operators are required to comply with a greater number of regulations, which are enforced at the state level.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the decline stage, making it difficult to gain access to credit to fund operations.
High capital requirements for inventory, retail locations and maintenance pose barriers.
High level of technology change requires keeping up with latest equipment and software.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies compete on providing high-end computers and laptops with cutting-edge technology and software.
Price is a primary basis after product selection, with some offering lowest price guarantees.
Free repair, maintenance services and superior customer service are key for retaining customers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top two companies are expected to account for only 14.5% of industry revenue in 2022.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Significant rental rates charged to consumers and companies
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Industry operators are able to realize relatively high profit due to the significant rental rates charged to consumers and companies.
Moreover, many companies are able to raise profit by charging additional fees for computers that include value-added software such as Microsoft Office.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The Computer Rental industry has a high level of capital intensity. For every $1.00 spent on wages, industry operators typically spend an estimated $0.77 on depreciable assets.
The industry's high level of capital intensity stems from the rapid obsolesce of computer technology.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the five years to 2022, the Computer Rental industry has been subject to a moderate level of revenue volatility. Demand for computer rental has declined in line with the falling price of computers and peripheral equipment.
Additionally, industry revenue declined sharply in 2020 alone due to the expected fall in demand resulting from the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The Computer Rental industry is characterized by to a high level of technological change. Computer technology and capabilities are rapidly changing as speed capabilities and storage capacities continue to improve.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Growing popularity of tablets and mobile devices
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The growing popularity and advancing technology of tablets and mobile devices has also limited industry demand.

FAQs.question: Does your company lease primarily to consumers or businesses?
FAQs.answer: Companies primarily lease to businesses because, for the most part, businesses require more equipment and therefore opt to lease rather than buy.

FAQs.question: How reliant is your business on the strength and stability of the US financial sector?
FAQs.answer: Increasing corporate profit and strength of the financial sector can benefit companies, however when profit is high companies will opt to purchase equipment rather than rent.

FAQs.question: How has your company coped with rising wage costs over the past year?
FAQs.answer: Companies have cut down on their workforce to mitigate the rising wage costs.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition possibilities in locations with well-established, dynamic commercial
FAQs.answer: Larger companies have increasingly acquired smaller, more niche operators mainly to expand geographic footprint.

FAQs.question: How much does your company spend on new technology annually?
FAQs.answer: Industry operators have been forced to constantly replace outdated equipment to keep up with technological change.

FAQs.question: How has your company leveraged online platforms?
FAQs.answer: Due to the growth of the internet, companies have transitioned to providing internet and web-based ordering, as well as associated client and account management systems.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Regulation that pertains to industry operators is relatively established and not likely to change. Industry regulation includes laws pertaining to consumer protection, sales finance and repayment of loans.

FAQs.question: Do you work with trade associations or other interest groups to advance your company's interests?
FAQs.answer: Companies work with several associations, such as the Equipment Leasing and Finance Association, to stay up to date on the latest equipment, industry research and ethical standards for industry operators.

FAQs.question: What percentage of your customers renew their contracts?
FAQs.answer: Larger companies benefit from exclusive contracts with large corporations and businesses to provide all necessary equipment.

FAQs.question: How do your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Average profit margins have decreased as a result of declining demand, which have been further exacerbated by the outbreak of COVID-19, as well as operator's difficulty to adjust inventory based on demand levels.

FAQs.question: How do you maintain optimum stock levels? What factors affect demand and stock levels? What methods have you used during times when stock levels are low?
FAQs.answer: Computer leasing companies must effectively manage their stock on hand or may incur additional storage costs.

FAQs.question: Who is your biggest competition? What sets your company apart from competitors? How do you monitor your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Companies compete heavily on the basis of price and knowledge of competing lease/hire agreements will aid the success of companies in this industry.

FAQs.question: Do your potential hires need to have past knowledge of the product? How do you ensure that all staff are thoroughly knowledgeable about the products? What is your training process like?
FAQs.answer: Companies should ensure that all staff members have suitable technical knowledge of the features and capabilities of all equipment for rent/lease.

FAQs.question: How has your revenue trended in relation to computer prices? What value can you add to your services as demand for computer equipment rental decreases?
FAQs.answer: The price of computers and peripheral equipment measures the cost of new computers and accessories, such as keyboards and hard drives. As the price of computers and peripheral equipment decreases, consumers and businesses are better able to afford their purchase outright. The price of computers and peripheral equipment has fallen significantly as a result of technological innovation.

FAQs.question: In which industries do your clients primarily participate? How do you monitor and respond to trends in these industries?
FAQs.answer: Rising corporate profit allows businesses to increase expenditure on computer hardware, whereas declining corporate profit induces businesses to delay acquiring new computers.

FAQs.question: How do you monitor trends in interest rates? What was the effect of low interest rates? How will it impact your strategy and pricing?
FAQs.answer: The yield on the 10-year Treasury note is an important demand determinant because movements in interest rates directly affect the attractiveness of renting computers. Low interest rates encourage businesses to rent computers because of the cost of financing hardware decreases. Conversely, high interest rates encourage businesses to purchase computer hardware outright.
